It is a tie on piece of cloth and the photo was originally scanned 
from the Kyoto Museum Exhibition book on the Shinsengumi (all in 
Japanese) ... I gave this book to someone ... we will have to double 
check and see if the book mentions the dimensions (please give us some 
time)

If the photos section is not working properly please see the sleeve 
insignias here
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/photos3.htm

I have seen cosplayers make their own imitations however they add more 
onto the design such as a line on the bottom...since this photo is 
from a prestigious museum very likely it is a totally real article (as 
is the case with the other artifacts)

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "michaelcarcana" <michaelcarcana@y...> 
wrote:
> I'm having trouble getting to the photos section right now, but if I 
> remember correctly there was a photo of the uniform shoulder patch.  
If 
> I also remember correctly, it was essentially the usual "makoto" ala 
> the Shinsengumi flag.  Does anyone know the dimensions of said 
patch?  
> If so, what are they?
> 
> Thanks,
> Mike
